s.text: I find that much of the time users have a very strong sense of what they like and dislike in language and are unwilling to let any so-called experts influence them.
I find that much of the time users have a very strong sense of what they like and dislike in language and are unwilling to let any so-called experts influence them.
For lexicographers, this manifests itself most annoyingly in the poor state of dictionary reviewing.

He makes the usual comments about how wonderful books are, and how an ideal home would have walls full of books, and then I got to this: "Every real book (as opposed to dictionaries, almanacs, and other compilations) is a mind, an imagination, a consciousness."
